009package com.weather.sdk.exception;
010
011/**
012 * Exception thrown when there are issues with SDK configuration.
013 *
014 * <p>This exception is thrown when:
015 *
016 * <ul>
017 *   <li>Invalid API key format or missing API key
018 *   <li>Invalid operation mode (not ON_DEMAND or POLLING)Invalid polling interval (negative, zero,
019 *       or unreasonably large)
020 *   <li>Invalid cache size (negative or zero)
021 *   <li>Invalid timeout values (negative or zero)
022 *   <li>Null or missing required configuration parameters
023 *   <li>Inconsistent configuration combinations
024 * </ul>
025 *
026 * <h2>Error Code</h2>
027 *
028 * <p>Error code: {@value #INVALID_CONFIG}
029 *
030 * <h2>Configuration Validation</h2>
031 *
032 * <p>The SDK validates all configuration parameters during builder construction:
033 *
034 * <ul>
035 *   <li><strong>API Key:</strong> Must not be null or empty
036 *   <li><strong>Mode:</strong> Must be ON_DEMAND or POLLING
037 *   <li><strong>Polling Interval:</strong> Must be positive and reasonable (max 24 hours)
038 *   <li><strong>Cache Size:</strong> Must be positive (max 1000 cities)
039 *   <li><strong>Timeouts:</strong> Must be positive and reasonable (max 60 seconds)
040 * </ul>
041 *
042 * <h2>Recovery Actions</h2>
043 *
044 * <ul>
045 *   <li>Verify all configuration parameters are within valid ranges
046 *   <li>Use the builder's validation methods before building
047 *   <li>Check for null values in required fields
048 *   <li>Use configuration constants for common values
049 *   <li>Implement configuration validation in tests
050 * </ul>
051 *
052 * <h2>Usage Examples</h2>
053 *
054 * <h3>Handling Configuration Exceptions</h3>
055 *
056 * <pre>
057 * try {
058 *   SDKConfiguration config = new WeatherSDKBuilder()
059 *       .apiKey("") // Invalid: empty API key
060 *       .mode(SDKMode.POLLING)
061 *       .pollingInterval(Duration.ofMinutes(-5)) // Invalid: negative interval
062 *       .build();
063 *
064 *   WeatherSDK sdk = new DefaultWeatherSDK(config);
065 * } catch (ConfigurationException e) {
066 *   logger.error("Configuration error ({}): {}", e.getErrorCode(), e.getMessage());
067 *
068 *   switch (e.getInvalidParameter()) {
069 *     case "apiKey":
070 *       logger.error("API key is required and cannot be empty");
071 *       break;
072 *     case "pollingInterval":
073 *       logger.error("Polling interval must be positive");
074 *       break;
075 *     case "cacheSize":
076 *       logger.error("Cache size must be positive");
077 *       break;
078 *   }
079 * }
080 * </pre>
081 *
082 * <h3>Proactive Configuration Validation</h3>
083 *
084 * <pre>
085 * public WeatherSDK createValidatedSDK(String apiKey, SDKMode mode) throws ConfigurationException {
086 *   if (apiKey == null || apiKey.trim().isEmpty()) {
087 *     throw new ConfigurationException("API key is required", "apiKey");
088 *   }
089 *
090 *   if (mode == null) {
091 *     throw new ConfigurationException("Operation mode is required", "mode");
092 *   }
093 *
094 *   try {
095 *     SDKConfiguration config = new WeatherSDKBuilder()
096 *         .apiKey(apiKey.trim())
097 *         .mode(mode)
098 *         .build();
099 *
100 *     return new DefaultWeatherSDK(config);
101 *   } catch (Exception e) {
102 *     throw new ConfigurationException("Invalid SDK configuration", e);
103 *   }
104 * }
105 * </pre>
106 *
107 * @since 1.0.0
108 * @see com.weather.sdk.config.WeatherSDKBuilder
109 * @see com.weather.sdk.config.SDKConfiguration
110 * @see com.weather.sdk.exception.WeatherSDKException
111 */
112public class ConfigurationException extends WeatherSDKException {
113
114  /** Serial version UID for serialization compatibility. */
115  private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
116
117  /** Error code for configuration-related issues. */
118  public static final String INVALID_CONFIG = "INVALID_CONFIGURATION";
119
120  /** The name of the configuration parameter that is invalid. */
121  private final String invalidParameter;
122
123  /**
124   * Constructs a new ConfigurationException with the specified message.
125   *
126   * @param message the detail message explaining the configuration error. Must not be null.
127   * @throws NullPointerException if message is null
128   */
129  public ConfigurationException(final String message) {
130    super(INVALID_CONFIG, message);
131    this.invalidParameter = null;
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Constructs a new ConfigurationException with the specified message and invalid parameter.
136   *
137   * @param message the detail message explaining the configuration error. Must not be null.
138   * @param invalidParameter the name of the configuration parameter that is invalid. May be null.
139   * @throws NullPointerException if message is null
140   */
141  public ConfigurationException(final String message, final String invalidParameter) {
142    super(INVALID_CONFIG, message);
143    this.invalidParameter = invalidParameter;
144  }
145
146  /**
147   * Constructs a new ConfigurationException with the specified message, invalid parameter, and
148   * cause.
149   *
150   * @param message the detail message explaining the configuration error. Must not be null.
151   * @param invalidParameter the name of the configuration parameter that is invalid. May be null.
152   * @param cause the underlying cause of the configuration error. May be null.
153   * @throws NullPointerException if message is null
154   */
155  public ConfigurationException(
156      final String message, final String invalidParameter, final Throwable cause) {
157    super(INVALID_CONFIG, message, cause);
158    this.invalidParameter = invalidParameter;
159  }
160
161  /**
162   * Returns the name of the configuration parameter that is invalid.
163   *
164   * @return the invalid parameter name, or null if not provided
165   */
166  public String getInvalidParameter() {
167    return invalidParameter;
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Indicates whether the error is related to API key configuration.
172   *
173   * @return true if the error is related to API key
174   */
175  public boolean isApiKeyError() {
176    return "apiKey".equalsIgnoreCase(invalidParameter);
177  }
178
179  /**
180   * Indicates whether the error is related to operation mode configuration.
181   *
182   * @return true if the error is related to mode
183   */
184  public boolean isModeError() {
185    return "mode".equalsIgnoreCase(invalidParameter);
186  }
187
188  /**
189   * Indicates whether the error is related to polling interval configuration.
190   *
191   * @return true if the error is related to polling interval
192   */
193  public boolean isPollingIntervalError() {
194    return "pollingInterval".equalsIgnoreCase(invalidParameter);
195  }
196
197  /**
198   * Indicates whether the error is related to cache configuration.
199   *
200   * @return true if the error is related to cache
201   */
202  public boolean isCacheError() {
203    return invalidParameter != null
204        && invalidParameter.toLowerCase(java.util.Locale.ROOT).contains("cache");
205  }
206
207  /**
208   * Indicates whether the error is related to timeout configuration.
209   *
210   * @return true if the error is related to timeout
211   */
212  public boolean isTimeoutError() {
213    return invalidParameter != null
214        && invalidParameter.toLowerCase(java.util.Locale.ROOT).contains("timeout");
215  }
216
217  /**
218   * Returns a descriptive category for the type of configuration error.
219   *
220   * @return a descriptive error category
221   */
222  public String getErrorCategory() {
223    final String result;
224    if (isApiKeyError()) {
225      result = "API Key Configuration Error";
226    } else if (isModeError()) {
227      result = "Mode Configuration Error";
228    } else if (isPollingIntervalError()) {
229      result = "Polling Interval Configuration Error";
230    } else if (isCacheError()) {
231      result = "Cache Configuration Error";
232    } else if (isTimeoutError()) {
233      result = "Timeout Configuration Error";
234    } else if (invalidParameter != null) {
235      result = "Parameter Configuration Error";
236    } else {
237      result = "Configuration Error";
238    }
239    return result;
240  }
241
242  /**
243   * Returns a suggested fix for the configuration error.
244   *
245   * @return a suggestion for fixing the configuration issue
246   */
247  public String getSuggestedFix() {
248    final String result;
249    if (isApiKeyError()) {
250      result = "Provide a valid, non-empty API key from OpenWeatherAPI";
251    } else if (isModeError()) {
252      result = "Use SDKMode.ON_DEMAND or SDKMode.POLLING";
253    } else if (isPollingIntervalError()) {
254      result = "Use a positive Duration (e.g., Duration.ofMinutes(5))";
255    } else if (isCacheError()) {
256      result = "Use a positive cache size (e.g., 10, 50, 100)";
257    } else if (isTimeoutError()) {
258      result = "Use positive timeout durations (e.g., Duration.ofSeconds(5))";
259    } else {
260      result = "Review configuration parameters and ensure all values are valid";
261    }
262    return result;
263  }
264
265  /**
266   * Returns the exception type description.
267   *
268   * @return "Configuration Error"
269   */
270  @Override
271  public String getExceptionType() {
272    return "Configuration Error";
273  }
274
275  /**
276   * Returns a detailed message including the invalid parameter if available.
277   *
278   * @return a detailed error message
279   */
280  @Override
281  public String getMessage() {
282    final String baseMessage = super.getMessage();
283    final String result;
284
285    if (invalidParameter != null) {
286      result = String.format("%s [Parameter: %s]", baseMessage, invalidParameter);
287    } else {
288      result = baseMessage;
289    }
290
291    return result;
292  }
293}
